intro: Sieruela iberidella, commonly known as the Iberian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sieruela iberidella is often found in mountainous regions and is considered a species of conservation interest due to its limited distribution.
